intro: Securidaca pubescens var. obovata, commonly known as the hairy sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds. The plant is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
